blaggregator.description: Blog post aggregator for the Recurse Center community
blaggregator.text:
Recursers write awesome blog posts all over the internet, and blaggregator is a Django powered site that aggregates all these posts. (You will need an RC login to view it).

The project was originally thought of, and built by Sasha. I've added a bunch of features to it, and help with maintaining it.
blaggregator.title: Blaggregator

cinspect.text:
cinspect attempts to extend Python's built-in inspect module to add "inspection" for Python's builtins and other objects not written in Python. It uses libclang to parse C-code and indexes it to allow looking up the source of the required objects, using an inspect-like API.

The original idea was from a friend, Tom Ballinger, who also helped me design and test it out.
cinspect.title: cinspect

cows-bulls.description: An online version of Cows & Bulls
cows-bulls.text: I built this site, in memory of the best cows & bulls player I've known. It is a simple client-side page with javascript that works offline too.
cows-bulls.title: Cows & Bulls

gethub.description: A Chrome extension for GitHub News Feed pop-up notifications
gethub.text:
GetHub was made for the geeks whose primary Social Network is GitHub and who keep checking for updates, a dozen times every hour. :)

This extension was written when pop-up notifications were newly introduced into Chrome, and I was excited by it. I now prefer a workspace with fewer distractions, and no longer use this.
gethub.title: GetHub

howdy.description: An Emacs-based tool to help keep in touch with people
howdy.text: Inspired by Sacha Chua and Michael Fogleman to try to keep in touch with friends and family better, I built a tool to keep track of my interactions.
howdy.title: Howdy

nikola.description: A static website and blog generator
nikola.text:
Nikola is a static site and blog generator written in Python that can generate a blog from input in many different markup formats.

This website has been generated using Nikola. I use the development branch of Nikola and actively contribute to the development of features that I need or fix bugs that affect me.
nikola.title: Nikola

nikola-orgmode-plugin.description: Emacs Org-mode compiler for Nikola sites.
nikola-orgmode-plugin.text: Nikola supports multiple markup formats as input, orgmode being one of them. The support for this is added by this plugin, and this blog is generated using this plugin.
nikola-orgmode-plugin.title: Nikola orgmode plugin

org2blog.description: Emacs mode for blogging from org-mode to Wordpress.
org2blog.text: I no longer actively maintain org2blog since I don't use any Wordpress blogs, anymore. If you are interested in maintaining this project, do get in touch.
org2blog.title: org2blog

statiki.description: An easy-to-use service for deploying simple web-sites
statiki.text: Statiki leverages free and open services and software like GitHub, TravisCI and Nikola to provide a means of deploying static websites, without needing any setup on the users' machine.
statiki.title: Statiki
